column13: BHP's teams have been improving the accessibility of their workplaces in Chile for people with a disability. column13: In 2022, BHP started its listening journey with a series of engagement sessions on racism led by Chief Commercial Officer (CCO) Vandita Pant. BHP dedicated listening sessions facilitated by external psychology and racial diversity experts and heard from 200 employees across BHP about their experience of racism at BHP. BHP's people reported a lack of capability in leaders and their processes in responding and reacting to racism. The listening sessions and learning from external experts, including the Australian Race Discrimination Commissioner, have helped inform BHP's work to improve the lived experience of its racially and culturally diverse workforce.
